channel.title: Reposting my guide on how to ollie form a while ago ok detail
channel.description:
Who is ready to learn how to Ollie... I bet you are.
Ok by now you have a nice board setup and are ready to learn this trick. Description: This is the trick that allows you to jump in the air with the board without using your hands.
The ollie is the most important trick you will ever learn in skateboarding so practice.
Feet Position -------------- This is the first step you want to know where to puts your feet if your goofy put your leading foot up in the middle of your board and your back in the middle of the tail and same thing if you are regular footed except your feet are in switched position. To understand what I mean I'm go to put some visual aid.
[IMG]http://i165.photobucket.com/albums/u46/gbx182/x1piYkpqHC_35lorxbiQG_6T5V74PWCMJ6U.gif[/img]
The Ollie ~~~~~~~\
Ok now for the time you all have been waiting for you have your stance ready and your eager to learn how to ollie. The first thing you want to do is get into goofy position if your goofy and regular if your regular.(I recommend that you learn this trick stationary before you learn it moving unless your daring.) Ok now your gonna want to slap down on your tail, and jump up as soon as you slap down on the tail and slide your front foot up the board and stop at the nose. When you are at the peek of your ollie level out your board push down with your feet and brace for impact.
When you land this trick along with any other trick scream shout or whatever else you want pat your self on the back. just have fun with this if your not skateboarding for fun or the love of it then your gonna have a bad time so don't skateboard just because everyone else is. You gotta love doing what you do and if you do good luck to you.
Things that could go wrong ------------------------------ There aren't too many thing that could go wrong when doing this trick.
(If you do not have your feet on the board just right anything that can go wrong will go wrong but here are some examples of what can happen)
1. when you ollie you move off of your board somehow(sometimes happens when your excited that you got into the air) and you land with one foot off and the other on the tail and the board comes up and hits you, if your a guy it a lot of the times hits your nuts, but girls you don't have to worry about that.
2. You don't get in the air. This can be fixed by watching yourself when you ollie, if you see that your not getting any air this can be fixed by jumping as high as you can and dragging your foot hard up the path of the board and evening out. If this does not work practice your ollie motion off the board and see how high your vertical jumps are so you don't get mad at yourself and throw the board.
3. If you try this trick moving the main things that could go wrong are you land while leaning back and your board comes out from under you and you fall. (You will fall but because you fall a lot don't give up Just practice practice practice your going to hear that a lot when you learn new tricks.
4. If not done appropriately Nothing will go wrong.
Closing ~~~~~~ If you have to work for your tricks like I don't that just makes it ten times more enjoyable when you land the trick so again don't give up just practice. Have fun with it, but don't throw your board. Throwing your board leads to many damages in your board which will lead to you getting hurt
[b]Warning:[/b] If you get hurt in anyway from this guide I am in no way responsible. learn this trick at your own risk. By reading this warning I am not liable for you getting hurt.
GOOD LUCK AND HAVE FUN!!!!!
sincerely JASON.
one of my tutorials i posted on gateofwarforums.
If this is considered spamming then delete it.

item.title: Reposting my guide on how to ollie form a while ago ok detail
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:34, topic:142437”][quote author=MybJames link=topic=194880.msg1767142#msg1767142 date=1190217954]
Exe626, you’re a fucknut, you just said that an ollie is a complex trick, but then say that is is basic…

There is not one pro who does not know how to ollie, if you can’t ollie then you shouldn’t become a pro.
[/quote]yay. It is basic, its the most basic land trick. At the same time its very complex. Yes, there is professionals who cannot do such things because they don’t do land tricks, or they just can’t do it. Damn, just let it go.[/quote]

While you may be right that it’s complex, you can’t possibly get sponsored if you can’t ollie.
If you can do any flip trick, you can usually ollie.
I would like you to find a professional skateboarder that can’t ollie, or even an amateur skateboarder who can’t.

Read full topic

My city has a brand new skate park that is cool.
I really like the bowl but still learning how to drop in.

item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Good lord, who taught him how to type. vbcoderx, Ollie is considerably one of the most complex tricks on flat land, and yes, alot of professional skateboarders cannot do it. Women go pro because they can do kickflips, laugh if you will, but its true. The way you brag about yourself is pathetic, I bet you can’t even keep your balance on the board. Just because an ollie is easy to you, doesn’t mean its easier to other people. You don’t need it to do everything, look for yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Reposting my guide on how to ollie form a while ago ok detail
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

wow u guys are nubs… u have no clue exe on anything about skateboarding… ollie is the most basic thing ever, and if your pro u can ollie… there is not such thing as a pro who can’t ollie… u need ollie for everything, even vert… u need it to grind, and other stuff… lol female sk8ers going pro cause they can kickflip… i lold hard and im at school… i can kickflip… but im not pro… almost everysk8er i can… why not try a tre flip or a nollie fronside cab? those are hard… or maybe a 20 ft wall ride… a local pro taught me how to wall ride a few years ago… its fundamentals… oh and if u cant ollie while moving, then u just need to practace more… wut u need to do is try ollieing at barely a move, and then when u get the hang of that, try at faster and faster speeds…

Read full topic
